review: Perhaps I should have thought about fidelity and noise when considering a device that uses only Wifi for communication, but perhaps I was simply optimistic. Regardless, the facts are these:I live in canada, which means that for the foreseeable future, I will be using the Chromecast exclusively with my Chrome browser, and no apps.I primarily want to stream local media from my pc, not netflix (I would rather have 1080P Netflix from my xbox, than 720P Netflix from a device that I don't have a remote for).Local media being played through my browser only works correctly with certain filetypes, but stutters and jumps. It's laggy.I've connected my pc through the lan, and that has alleviated much of the issue, but the playback framerate is still not perfect. I can deal with a little blocking or quality loss, but awkward stopping and starting of playback is unacceptable.Having said what I have said, I will be keeping the device, getting updates, and hoping support for canada and everyone improves.
author: Kyle

review: I wa so looking forward to using this device. After hooking it up we could not get it to work. We then called chromecast  for help.We spent 1 1/2 hours on the phone with the helpline. If this is true it certainly wasn't marked on the info I read. I was very disappointed. Will look around for another device  that we might be able to use.
